text: Kurdish Peshmerga fighters on the front
line close to besieged amerli this
position has been attacked several times
by the Islamists but the Kurds have held
the line this is about as close as the
outside world can get to the besieged
town of amerli
it lies behind the town you can see
behind us there which is occupied by the
Islamic state fighters and you can see
their black flag on the building just a
few hundred meters or yards away from
here it's believed that around 16,000
people are trapped in desperate
conditions in amerli with virtually
nothing coming in and nobody able to
escape hussain amin did manage to get
out just as the siege began but his
family is still trapped in a murali they
tell him on the phone that the situation
is terrible with little food water or
electricity I asked him what would
happen if the Islamic state militants
moved in they will start of them all
that's what we expect the people have no
way out it's all mines and the snipers
where can they run the district mayor in
a nearby town appeal to us to tell the
outside world there was an urgent need
for it to step in and avert a massacre
we want military help has happened in
other place humanitarian aid but also
air support by the Americans we want it
as soon as possible to save the people
of Emily the Americans have been
carrying out airstrikes but only in
support of Iraqi Kurdistan not in other
parts of Iraq like amerli the local
Kurdish commander says his orders are to
stay on the defensive for the moment the
besieged minority under threat at our
Murli is on its own
Jim Europe BBC news in northern Iraq
